Identifying #skillneeds for the greening of the economy and translating this in #qualifications, standards, programmes + curricula require timely/robust #skillsintelligence. So, we combine VET policy analysis with skills intelligence.
Cedefop Dep Dir Mara Brugia
#GreenSkillsinVET https://t.co/5wC6NhWlcj

We see the first positive effects the greening of the economy has triggered in the demand for jobs/skills affected by the green transition. But we also see recruitment bottlenecks emerging in labour market areas, such as construction.
Cedefop Dep Dir Mara Brugia
#GreenSkillsinVET https://t.co/lBbXkOdKBm

A greener Europe will not come at the cost of lower employment. But we know that some sectors, Member States or regions might be exposed to negative employment effects in the transition phase.

Cedefop Deputy Director Mara Brugia at the #GreenSkillsinVET conference https://t.co/5yw6I2wslC
